Issuing Certificates

  1. Prerequisites
- If you are using the blockchain.info API, start the blockchain.info server

    ```
    blockchain-wallet-service start --port 3000
    ```
- Otherwise start your local bitcoind client (use regtest mode to preview!)

  1. Add your certificates to data/unsigned_certs/

  2. Make sure you have enough BTC in your issuing address. Each certificate costs 15000 satoshi ($0.06 USD)

    Important note on denominations: If you are running a bitcoind node, note that the standard cli denomination is bitcoins not satoshis! In the cert-issuer app, the standard unit is Satoshis (this is common in other apis), and the values are converted to bitcoin first.

    a. If you're using bitcoind, transfer money by the command line. bitcoin-cli sendtoaddress $issuer <amount>

    b. Otherwise transfer with your online wallet

  3. Run the create-certificates.py script to create your certificates. If you've installed the package you can run: python cert-issuer -c conf.ini
